# With Google
```{r}

colnames(google_trends) <- gsub("hurricane_|_us", "", colnames(google_trends))

google_trends_long <- google_trends %>% 
  pivot_longer(., cols = -c("date"), names_to = "hurricane", values_to = "values" )


google_trends_long %>% 
  ggplot(., aes(x = date,  group = hurricane)) +
  geom_density(adjust=1.5, alpha=.2) +
    theme_ipsum()+
   facet_wrap(~hurricane)


google_trends_long %>% 
  ggplot(., aes(x = date,  group = hurricane, y = values, color = hurricane )) +
  geom_point(alpha=.45) +
    theme_ipsum()



google_trends_long %>% 
  ggplot(., aes(x = date,  group = hurricane, y = values, color = hurricane )) +
  geom_ribbon()+
    theme_ipsum()
```
